Package paoo.game.main

Class UI

java.lang.Object
paoo.game.main.UI
public class UI extends Object
Handles all user interface rendering and management for the game. This class is responsible for drawing various game screens including title screen, game HUD, menus, dialog boxes, and managing user interface state.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    UI()
    Constructs a new UI instance.

  • Constructor Details

    • UI

      public UI()
      Constructs a new UI instance. Initializes fonts, loads heart images, and sets up the UI system.

  • Method Details

    • getCommandNum

      public int getCommandNum()
      Gets the current command number (selected menu option).
      Returns:
      The current command number

    • getPlayTime

      public double getPlayTime()
      Gets the current play time in seconds.
      Returns:
      The current play time

    • getSlotRow

      public int getSlotRow()
      Gets the current inventory slot row.
      Returns:
      The current slot row

    • getSlotCol

      public int getSlotCol()
      Gets the current inventory slot column.
      Returns:
      The current slot column

    • setCommandNum

      public void setCommandNum(int commandNum)
      Sets the current command number (selected menu option).
      Parameters:
      commandNum - The command number to set

    • setPlayTime

      public void setPlayTime(double playTime)
      Sets the current play time.
      Parameters:
      playTime - The play time to set in seconds

    • setCurrentDialogue

      public void setCurrentDialogue(String currentDialogue)
      Sets the current dialogue text to be displayed.
      Parameters:
      currentDialogue - The dialogue text to display

    • setSlotCol

      public void setSlotCol(int slotCol)
      Sets the current inventory slot column.
      Parameters:
      slotCol - The slot column to set

    • setSlotRow

      public void setSlotRow(int slotRow)
      Sets the current inventory slot row.
      Parameters:
      slotRow - The slot row to set

    • getSubState

      public int getSubState()
      Gets the current sub-state for menu navigation.
      Returns:
      The current sub-state

    • showMessage

      public void showMessage(String message)
      Displays a temporary message on screen. The message will automatically disappear after a short duration.
      Parameters:
      message - The message text to display

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2)
      Main drawing method that renders the appropriate UI based on current game state. This method delegates to specific drawing methods based on the current game state.
      Parameters:
      g2 - The Graphics2D object to draw with

    • drawTitleScreen

      public void drawTitleScreen()
      Draws the title screen with game logo and main menu options. Includes "New Game", "Load Game", and "Exit" options with navigation cursor.

    • drawTimer

      public void drawTimer()
      Draws the game timer in the top-right corner of the screen. Updates and displays the current play time in seconds.

    • drawPauseScreen

      public void drawPauseScreen()
      Draws the pause screen with "PAUSED" text centered on screen.

    • drawDialogScreen

      public void drawDialogScreen()
      Draws the dialog screen with a text box containing the current dialogue. Supports multi-line text separated by newline characters.

    • drawPlayerLife

      public void drawPlayerLife()
      Draws the player's health bar using heart images. Shows current health with full hearts, half hearts, and empty hearts.

    • drawMonsterLife

      public void drawMonsterLife()
      Draws health bars for monsters currently visible on screen. Regular monsters show small health bars above them, while boss monsters show larger health bars at the bottom of the screen with their name.

    • drawInventory

      public void drawInventory()
      Draws the inventory screen showing player's items in a grid layout. Includes item icons, quantities, selection cursor, and item descriptions.

    • gameOverScreen

      public void gameOverScreen()
      Draws the game over screen with retry and quit options. Displays "Game Over!" text with menu navigation.

    • gameEndScreen

      public void gameEndScreen()
      Draws the game completion screen showing victory message and final play time. Includes options to return to title screen or quit the game.

    • drawOptionScreen

      public void drawOptionScreen()
      Draws the options/settings screen with various sub-menus. Handles navigation between different option categories.

    • options_top

      public void options_top(int frameX, int frameY)
      Draws the main options menu with settings for music, sound effects, controls, etc.
      Parameters:
      frameX - The x-coordinate of the options frame
      frameY - The y-coordinate of the options frame

    • options_savedGame

      public void options_savedGame(int frameX, int frameY)
      Draws the save game confirmation screen.
      Parameters:
      frameX - The x-coordinate of the options frame
      frameY - The y-coordinate of the options frame

    • option_control

      public void option_control(int frameX, int frameY)
      Draws the control scheme information screen.
      Parameters:
      frameX - The x-coordinate of the options frame
      frameY - The y-coordinate of the options frame

    • options_endGameConfirmation

      public void options_endGameConfirmation(int frameX, int frameY)
      Draws the end game confirmation dialog.
      Parameters:
      frameX - The x-coordinate of the options frame
      frameY - The y-coordinate of the options frame

    • getItemIndexLSot

      public int getItemIndexLSot()
      Calculates the inventory item index based on current slot position. Uses a 5-column grid layout to convert row/column coordinates to array index.
      Returns:
      The calculated item index in the inventory array

    • drawSubWindow

      public void drawSubWindow(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Draws a styled sub-window with rounded corners and border. Used for dialog boxes, menus, and other UI panels.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the window
      y - The y-coordinate of the window
      width - The width of the window
      height - The height of the window

    • getXCenteredText

      public int getXCenteredText(String text)
      Calculates the x-coordinate to center text horizontally on the screen.
      Parameters:
      text - The text string to center
      Returns:
      The x-coordinate for centered text positioning

    • getXAlignToRightText

      public int getXAlignToRightText(String text, int tailX)
      Calculates the x-coordinate to align text to the right from a given position. Used for right-aligning numbers and other UI elements.
      Parameters:
      text - The text string to align
      tailX - The right edge x-coordinate to align to
      Returns:
      The x-coordinate for right-aligned text positioning
